title: Added a rule to R.cond warning if the last condition is not a R.T.
body:
This PR adds the `cond-default` rule.

It suggests to have `R.T` as the last condition so it acts as the default value.

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

title: Don't declare and <-> or as complements
body:
I tried to add `nand` as function to ramda-adjunct, see https://github.com/char0n/ramda-adjunct/issues/237. When I tried to do that, eslint-plugin-ramda complaint about `complement(and)` being replaceable by `or`.

This is strictly not true for one case:

```
R.or(false, false) -> false
R.complement(R.and(false, false)) -> true
```

Am I missing something?

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

title: Rule composition preference
body:
Add `composition-preference` rule.

This rule is similar to `compose-pipe-style` but allows for some flexibility - you can specify desired style for single line and multiline expressions.
It also contains fixer that flips order of arguments and changes name of function. If any comment exist inside pipe/compose prior to auto-fix it'll do its best to make it stay in proper place.

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

title: Update to Node v6 compatibility (#22)
body:
This commit bumps the compatibility for the plugin to Node 6, the
current Maintenance LTS.  Node v4 is [no longer supported][node], so
it's not that big of a stretch to do this.  That said, it *does*
explicitly break API compatibility, so the Major version had to go up by
one (plus a beta tag so it isn't just installed by default).

[node]: https://github.com/nodejs/Release#readme

Signed-off-by: Jonathan Sifuentes <jayands.dev@gmail.com>

title: Simplify and fix error reporting for prefer-complement
body: This PR simplifies and fixes the error reporting for `prefer-complement`. Cases with arrow functions, anonymous function expressions, member expressions and call expressions are not covered. --- This change is[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/ramda/eslint-plugin-ramda/18)

title: Add prefer-both-either
body: This pull request adds the prefer-both-either rule. It suggests using `both`/`either` instead of `allPass`/`anyPass` with a list of only two predicates. Closes #15 --- This change is[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/ramda/eslint-plugin-ramda/16)

title: Bugfix for map and bump version
body:
This pull-request fixes a bug where `map(prop(__, obj))` was being incorrectly caught by the linter.
It also bumps the version to publish with the previous 2 rules and adds missing `eq-by-simplification` to `README.md`.

title: Add rule `eq-by-simplification`
body:
This pull-request adds the `eq-by-simplification` rule.

It suggests using `eqProps` instead of `eqBy(prop(_))`.

title: Add compose-pipe-style rule
body: ### Add `compose-pipe-style` rule Enforce a style for compose and pipe: compose for single line expression, pipe for multiline. - Valid ```js compose(a, b, c) pipe( a, b, c ) ``` - Invalid ```js compose( a, b, c ) pipe(a, b, c) ``` --- This change is[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/ramda/eslint-plugin-ramda/10)

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

title: Detect new code smells
body:
### Add `prefer-ramda-boolean` rule

- Valid
```js
R.T
R.F
```

- Invalid
```js
function () { return true; }
() => { return true; }
() => false
```

### Add `always-simplification` rule

- Valid
```js
R.T
R.F
```

- Invalid
```js
always(true)
always(false)
```

### Add `pipe-simplification` and `compose-simplification`

Suggesting composition of `map` and `flatten` to be `chain`.

### Detects `map(pickAll(_))`

And suggests using `project`.

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda

repo.name: eslint-plugin-ramda
repo.description: :ram: ESLint rules for use with Ramda

title: Support for specialized functions
body:
This pull-request implements support for specialized calls via `R`. Soon, a good improvement will be making the a parameter, but it solves the problem for now. I suggest using `2.1.0` as version name for this.

Now, both `R.map(R.prop)` and `map(prop)` can be recognized and works mutually. Adapting to check the scope later also became easier; I've added an `ast-helper` to get the work done. We currently have `135` tests.

This introduces no breaking changes.
This introduces no new rules.

Closes #7.
Thanks @polytypic for reporting and @lo1tuma for the idea.

title: Forbid Node v4 common syntax
body: I've replaced `xo` linter by `eslint` itself. Now, destructuring patterns are forbidden until next year because they break compatibility with Node v4 and v5.

title: Update supported nodejs versions
body:
This updates the travis-ci settings to also build for nodejs 8 and 9. Apart from that I think we should drop support for:

* nodejs 4: current builds for nodejs 4 fail (see e.g. [this build](https://travis-ci.org/rung-tools/eslint-plugin-ramda/jobs/301914097)) and nodejs 4 will be end of life in april 2018
* nodejs 7: this node version has already reached end of life

@haskellcamargo What do you think?
